It is against the interests of a policy owner and the life insurance industry to practice “twisting”. “Twisting” means ______.

options.A: A form of upselling in which a policy owner is induced to increase coverage by purchasing a new policy, with full disclosure of differences and consequences.
options.B: A form of misrepresentation in which a policy owner is induced to continue an insurance policy and purchase a new one without full disclosure.
